org.dyn4j.dynamics.joint

Class DistanceJoint

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.dyn4j.dynamics.Constraint
      • org.dyn4j.dynamics.joint.Joint
        • org.dyn4j.dynamics.joint.DistanceJoint

  • public class DistanceJoint
extends Joint
    Represents a fixed length distance joint.

    Given the two world space anchor points a distance is computed and used to constrain the attached Bodys.

    This joint doubles as a spring/damper distance joint where the length can change but is constantly approaching the target distance. Enable the spring/damper by setting the frequency to a value greater than zero.

    Nearly identical to Box2d's equivalent class.

    Since:
    1.0.0
    Version:
    3.1.5
    Author:
    William Bittle
    See Also:
    Box2d

    • Constructor Detail

      • DistanceJoint

        public DistanceJoint(Body body1,
             Body body2,
             Vector2 anchor1,
             Vector2 anchor2)
        Minimal constructor.

        Creates a fixed distance Joint where the joined Bodys do not participate in collision detection and resolution.

        Parameters:
        body1 - the first Body
        body2 - the second Body
        anchor1 - in world coordinates
        anchor2 - in world coordinates
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if body1, body2, anchor1, or anchor2 is null
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if body1 == body2

      • shiftCoordinates

        protected void shiftCoordinates(Vector2 shift)
        Description copied from class: Constraint
        Shifts (translates) the coordinates of this constraint.

        Typically this method should not be called directly. Instead use the World.shiftCoordinates(Vector2) method to move the entire world.

        Specified by:
        shiftCoordinates in class Constraint
        Parameters:
        shift - the distance to shift along the x and y axes
